intro: Agalinis angustifolia, commonly known as slenderstem bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils in open habitats such as pine woods and disturbed areas. It produces small, dark blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Agalinis angustifolia is often found in low, scattered colonies and is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
